abstract.text: Requests permission to temporarily use location services with full accuracy and reports the results to the provided completion handler.

inlineContent.text: A key in the
dictionary of the app’s
file.  The value for this key is an app-provided string that describes the reason for accessing location data with full accuracy.  To localize a usage description, add an entry to your
file with the same key you provide for this parameter.
A closure to execute after authorization status changes. This closure takes a single
parameter, which is
if the prompt was displayed to the user, or an error object describing why the prompt couldn’t be displayed.
You can call this method from synchronous code using a completion handler, as shown on this page, or you can call it as an asynchronous method that has the following declaration:
For information about concurrency and asynchronous code in Swift, see

After the user gives permission for your app to use location data with full accuracy, your app can access that data in the foreground or in the background, until its permission automatically expires. Expiration is postponed while your app is actively in use. For example, expiration is postponed while your app in the foreground, and while a Continuous Background Location session is active with the background location indicator enabled. This approach to expiration allows apps to provide experiences that require full accuracy, such as fitness and navigation apps, even if the user doesn’t grant persistent access for full accuracy.

The completion closure is guaranteed to be called after the request is completed, which includes the user granting access, the user declining, or an error that prevented displaying the prompt. The closure is always called in the same threading context as
methods. If the prompt was successfully displayed to the user, the callback’s
parameter is
The request always fails with a
error in the following cases:
The
file doesn’t have an entry for the given
value.
The app is already authorized for full accuracy.
The app is in the background.

If the closure is called with an error, log the error for debugging purposes, and retry the request again the next time the user performs the action that caused you to request precise location information.

abstract.text: Obtain the geographic location and orientation of a device.
Constants that indicate the app’s authorization to use location services.
A constant that indicates the user didn’t grant the requested temporary authorization.
The object you use to start and stop the delivery of location-related events to your app.
The current authorization status for the app.
Requests the user’s permission to use location services regardless of whether the app is in use.
Requests permission to temporarily use location services with full accuracy.
Requests permission to temporarily use location services with full accuracy and reports the results to the provided completion handler.
Requests the user’s permission to use location services while the app is in use.
The methods you use to receive events from an associated location-manager object.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the user’s location information at all times.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the app requests reduced location accuracy by default.
A collection of messages that explain why the app is requesting temporary access to the user’s location.
Learn how functions and methods that take a completion handler are converted to Swift asynchronous functions.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
